result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel T Segura was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. No contact, directly or indirectly, with Daniel Pavia, Erica Hammersmith, Jennifer Alton, or Jacob Lohmeyer. May not contact any of those individuals by text, twitter or any other method.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law within 10 days of today's date and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.   Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation. Defendant must be 100% compliant with all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: To be completed during the term of probation.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Samuel T Segura in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends 3 yrs probation w/conditions to include 90 days RCJ. Defense agrees with probation and asks the Court to allow expungement if defendant successfully completes probation.

BTC: sent w/held - 3 yrs probation. Matter may be expunged upon successful completion of probation. Must be 100% compliant with all rules and regulations of probation.

TO BE CO-SIGNED WITH MOTHER ERICA C. CARTER, DOB 4/27/74 WITH PHOTO ID. Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(h)1-PCS/intent-THC; Ct 2: 961.42(1)-Maintain drug trafficking place; Ct 3: 961.573(1)-PDP. No contact with the co-defendant's (person, property, residence or family).
  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
